sols_html:
Recall the solution from part (a):

\[\begin{aligned} x(t)=\pm\sqrt{\tilde ce^t + 2}.\end{aligned}\]

To satisfy the initial condition \(x(0)=2\), we calculate

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 2 = x(0)=\pm\sqrt{\tilde ce^0+2}\end{aligned}\]

We see, that this can only be fullfilled with the plus sign.

\[\begin{aligned} x(0)=\sqrt{\tilde c + 2}=2,\end{aligned}\]

\[\begin{aligned} \tilde c=2.\end{aligned}\]

So, the solution of the differential equation with initial condition is

\[\begin{aligned} x(t)=\sqrt{2e^t+2}.\end{aligned}\]
